original_title: Sri Lanka bonds yield open steady, rupee at 293.00/295.00 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bonds opened steady on Friday, dealers said, after the central bank cut its main policy rate by 250 basis points.
The Spot US dollar was quoted at 293.00/295.00 rupees after closing at 292.50/295.50 to the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 24.25/75 percent down from 24.50/90  percent a day earlier, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 25.75/26.25 percent up from 25.00/26.00 percent a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 was quoted at 26.25/50 percent, down from 26.30/27.00 per cent at last close.
The central bank cut its policy rate at which overnight money is injected to 14.0 percent from 16.5 percent Thursday. There is a gap between the injection rate and market rates.
Sri Lanka exports down in April, trade deficit up from March, rupee stronger
Sri Lanka has not issued bonds recently and has mostly sold Treasury bills, ahead of a debt restructuring strategy being announced. (Colombo/ June 02/2023)
